This comes after Russia fired on Syria in August, killing more than 100 people and wounding close to 800. Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said his country was ready to participate in the war if it could do so. "We will be prepared to take part, if necessary, in any operation that we send military forces to Syria, and we will respond accordingly," he told reporters in Moscow. Russian President Vladimir Putin also said that if the Ukrainian war with Russia ended, it would have been a "historic catastrophe" for the region. Russia has accused Ukraine of being the victim of an "unprecedented, unprovoked attack" on its territory. The US and other Western powers accused Ukraine of violating the sovereignty of its capital, Kiev, by sending in Russian warplanes to the east of the country. But Ukrainian officials pointed to the UN Security Council resolution authorizing the deployment of US troops, which has been criticised by Western officials. UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon issued a statement condemning the Russian air attack and called on the Security Council to take appropriate steps to protect civilians in Ukraine. The Security Council has already adopted a resolution calling for a "permanent ceasefire" in the conflict zone in eastern Ukraine. It has been unclear exactly how many US troops and equipment will be sent to Ukraine - although Russia has been pressing for the move for months. The EU, Britain and France have all been in contact with Kiev. EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell has said that the EU should have a "full debate" about the future of military assistance to Ukraine, but his comments came after Russian defence minister Sergei Shoigu told the UN General Assembly that the EU's support for Ukraine should not be considered political support for Russia. "There is no need for us to get involved in a political battle," Shoigu said. "I think we should be working together, not as a single entity." The Russian defence ministry said it was "in no way" supporting the Russian air strikes. It had previously said that it was sending US troops to support Ukraine's forces in the east of the country.
